com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSCanOrderBeProcessedUE


  • public interface YFSCanOrderBeProcessedUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canOrderBeProcessed(YFSEnvironment env, java.lang.String transactionId, java.util.Map orderHeaderBuf)
      The YFSCanOrderBeProcessedUE user exit is called from allocation transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • canOrderBeProcessed

        boolean canOrderBeProcessed(YFSEnvironment env,
                            java.lang.String transactionId,
                            java.util.Map orderHeaderBuf)
                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSCanOrderBeProcessedUE user exit is called from allocation transaction. By default only orders that are not held and have a payment status of PAID, AUTHORIZED, or INVOICED can be processed. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to extend or override checks made on the order.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Pre-conditions: The user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should be updated to either true or false.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to either raise errors or access environment information.
        transactionId - Transaction which is calling the user exit. See the Transactions navigation bar button for the transaction IDs.
        orderHeaderBuf - Map containing the following keys: canOrderBeProcessed_dbd.txt


        Returns:
        A flag which should be set to True if an order can be processed. Otherwise it is set to False.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
